title: Never get tired of this area
reviews: Tourists new to Vancouver should be sure to spend at least a few hours in this neighbourhood, which is anything but touristy. About ten minutes from downtown on the Skytrain, then walk a few blocks to the north. All of a sudden, funky shops, open air coffee shops and markets, people that look like they've never read a fashion magazine - great food, great coffee, great atmosphere. While there are some spots that have succumbed to gentrification, most of the neighbourhood remains as it was a generation ago. Enjoy it while you still can.

title: Little Italy Vancouver
reviews: When visiting Vancouver you must enjoy a fine Italian Restaurant, and experience Little Italy on Commercial Drive on the East side of Vancouver. Well worth it!

title: Central Cultural St Italian quarters
reviews: Fun part of Vancouver. Definitely visit as it’s the central meeting point of the skytrain public transit line so easy to get off and back on with the same transfer. Home of the World Cup soccer games and parade. Tones of great eats and bars. A little rough around the edges still with homeless but not dangerous. Great Italian restaurants and fun ethics shops like vintage stores, organic supermarkets and unique gift shops. Great people watching. Have fun exploring !

title: Very popular,
reviews: The two Skytrains meet there, Greenline that goes to and from Coquitlam, the other one or way goes via Burnaby, New Westminster, and back into Vancouver the M line.  The other Skytrain goes to and from Surrey, and to and from Vancouver

title: Great mix of restaurants
reviews: Spent 3 days in a Airbnb near to commercial drive, good choice of quirky shops and easy links to the city via the metro.

title: good food and coffee scene
reviews: We stayed in East Van instead of downtown and glad we did as the food and bar scene is great much better than downtown

title: Great area to explore!
reviews: We have been to Vancouver numerous times but this was the first time it was on our radar.  We were concerned it would be too far away, but by taking the Sky Train, it is a piece of cake.  I don’t think I have ever seen seen so many intriguing restaurants of different countries and ethnicity ever! It was fun to walk and look at the varied shops, eateries, coffee houses and book stores.  We spent hours poking around.  I would recommend this area highly!

title: Great place to visit
reviews: We come down here to eat and shop and go to Italian days. They have lots of different shops like candy, used clothing, hardware, flower, grocery, deli, fruit, cheese stores and many different types of restaurants and coffee shops.

title: Quirky Street
reviews: Commercial Drive is located in East Vancouver and hosts hundreds of small independent businesses and shops. There are also a number of events hosted on 'the drive' such as Italia Day, which is a great time. The street has a lot of character and is easily accessible via the Commercial-Broadway skytrain station on the Expo and Millennium line.

title: Great selection of shops
reviews: This used to be called a Little Italy . There are way more ethnic shops now along the way. Lots of retro clothes shops, second hand and collector shops. Vegan and vegetarian shops too.

title: What a dive
reviews: We grew up and lived in Greater Vancouver,  for nearly 60 years but haven’t re-visited this area for a few decades. We went on a Sunday afternoon expecting a clean, cool vibrant area a bit like Kits, and we quite surprised to find it more like East Cordova. A few street people laying on the sidewalk, grubby cafes ( I cringe at what the kitchens must look like )and second hand stores, tattoo parlours etc. People trying to to sell their wares in the park- looked mostly like dumpster pickins’. Plenty of piercings and tattoos to be seen, lots of...”unique folk”. We certainly wouldn’t want to eat anywhere there. We’d be embarrassed for any tourists that happened across it thinking this was Vancouver.Sorry if we’re just not hip enough, but no thanks.

title: A neighbourhood!!
reviews: We are new to Vancouver and are still exploring.  We visited Commercial Drive expecting to be underwhelmed...what a pleasant surprise!!  This area has a real neighbourhood feel, with real houses, not a sea of concrete and high rise condos.  Eclectic mix of stores, restaurants, small markets, bakeries and coffee shops.  Nothing glitzy, upscale or swanky.  There are a few life style shops and clothing stores hinting at gentrification but most things are affordable and casual.  Met some nice shopkeepers as well as some colourful local characters.  For sure, we'll go back.

title: Still worth seeing
reviews: The neighborhood has been long gentrified, but the drive is still a wonderful multi-cultural mix of restaurants, retail, and people-watching.  Hipster heaven.

title: A Vibrant Gem
reviews: Commercial drive really is a special place where everyone is welcome. The vibe is so chill and without judgment. It’s great to see a place like Commercial Drive be so vibrant and continue to evolve. The street is lined with a variety of eclectic shops, amazing restaurants and a real mix of cultures which melt into something special without judgement or prejudice.

title: Little Italy disappears
reviews: Not too long ago Commercial Drive was Vancouver's Little Italy. Over time the Italians moved east (retained all the Real Estate) and gave up a great part of Commercial Drive to an eclectic harmony of various ethnic groups. Now the Drive is amazingly popular for a variety of food experiences, restaurants, coffee haunts, food produce funky shops and still some of the best pizza in the city. Beautiful street worth the walk. Houses in the area are period as is for the most part the Drive. Check it out.

title: The Best Neighbourhood
reviews: I love this street. All kinds of interesting shops (Dr. Vigari, Magnet Hardware, Santa Barbara Market to name a few). Great vibe. A real community feel.

title: A taste of Vancouver!
reviews: On our last day in Vancouver we wanted to experience a local neighborhood. Our concierge recommended we go visit what  the locals know as the drive. Very international flavour of restaurants, such friendly people!

title: Fun walk on a sunny day
reviews: Lots of net little restaurants and places to sit to have a drink as you watch the world go by. If you are a soccer fan you can enhance your World Cup experience by visiting thi eclectic street scene.

title: Lots of variety on one street!!
reviews: You can't go wrong visiting Commercial Drive - lots of restaurants to pick from and amazing coffee shops.  Lots of culture to see on this street.

title: Funkiest Neighbourhood In Vancouver?
reviews: This little area, stretching a dozen blocks north of the Skytrain stations at Broadway, is a true distinct neighbourhood. The atmosphere is one of counter-culture attitude, reminiscent of the 1960's. The strong influence of "Little Italy" adds to the distinct tone of the area I can't find anywhere else in Vancouver. Don't bring your car, do take either train line to Broadway; and enjoy the walk, the shops, and the cafes.

title: Lots of little hidden gems
reviews: Best explored on foot. Just lookout for people who don't know what stop signs mean when you are crossing the street... lots of great places to eat or grab a coffee or browse the shops

title: Love it here
reviews: Fantastic cafes with delicious food, perfect for breakfast. Also, there are some great second hand stores ( some are quite expensive) with really cool clothes and a theatre. I love spending time here, the vibe of the drive is really relaxed.

title: Some very nice shops, quite small though
reviews: The drive had some very nice independent shops and bars that were very cool. However, it is slightly smaller than you expect, so realistically you will only be here for a couple of hours max.

title: This is a great area for a walk, a little shopping and some great foody opportunities.
reviews: We love the "drive" as there are funky stores, cute boutiques, great restaurants and even interesting people.  It is a wonderful place for a stroll and you can catch breakfast, lunch or dinner in any number of great eateries and they are mostly affordable and with tasty options.  Shopping is interesting with items from many places in the world.

title: Cool Eclectric Street Lined with Shops and Restaurant
reviews: This street is about half mile long with shops and restaurants that the locals go to.  The price is very affordable.

title: Unique
reviews: A great place to stroll on a leisurely afternoon. The unique blend of small independent shops and restaurants adds flavor to the neighborhood.

title: Coffee with a friend
reviews: Great street to walk. People watching or a excellent selection of different restaurants. Tried a Jamaican rest & was very good.

title: Funky folks, funky restaurants, Little Italy getting gentrified but still cool
reviews: In the heart of The Republic of East Vancouver, Commercial Drive still maintains a bit of an edge in terms of its political thinking.  Lots of alternative types hanging around, as well as up-market hipsters.  Great restaurants, the best of which as far as I am concerned is The Libra Room.  A wonderful bar/restaurant with fantastic live jazz every night.  The food is really good, inventive and affordable..  I love this place to bits.  Go there, dont wait!

title: The hippy side of town
reviews: We were here on the car free day between 1st and 14th Ave. The street was abuzz with stalls selling goods and activist stalls. The home made ice pops were particularly good! Normally Commercial Drive is an eclectic area of cafes, restaurants, pot shops and great transport, with easy access to the sky train and buses to Scince World, Granville, Canada Place etc. the surrounding area is very family orientated and you are not far from the Trout Lake Community Centre. Safeway is located next to the skytrain station on 10th Ave, for grocery shopping too. It is an easy area to stay.

title: Different Vibe of Vancouver
reviews: I  really really enjoyed this neighborhood! They offered a lot of variety when it comes to their shops and restos. There are a lot of pizza places; however, they all offered a unique twist to their dish! So many amazing and quaint shops. From house plants, to freshly brewed coffees, you cannot miss this place!

title: The Drive
reviews: I stayed at an Arbnb in this area. Commercial Drive is a very old school, trendy street with all sorts of bars, restaurants, cafes, shops, and services. It's a nice change from the downtown core of big retail outlets and chain stores. If you want to experience some truly authentic Vancouver culture, then head to The Drive.

title: Quaint neighborhood
reviews: Great Italian and Spanish restarants along the Drive. Funky shops and a real beighborhood feel. Many days are closed to traffic like Italian Days. Great place to take in soccer games in the coffee shops.

title: Variety of different stores
reviews: Commercial Drive Vancouver British Columbia was a little sleepy at the time we first arrived, it does get very crowded and busy.  Traffic seems to be gridlocked no matter what time you are there.Good variety of businesses and restaurants.

title: I love the drive
reviews: Great food options that will cater to anyone's wants/needs, good coffee shops, dessert spots.  Parking can be a headache at times, but usually not an issue.

title: Never heard of this place, then be adventurous!
reviews: Are you interested in Italian, Mexican, Cuban, Greek and other specialty food, as well as vegan and vegetarian options galore, great little bar clubs, jazz and live music, big outdoor sidewalk patios, great street to walk and enjoy activities? Then this is your place! It's a charming neighborhood! Take the sky train from downtown to Commercial and Broadway if you don't have a car - no worries, very walkable!

title: Local color
reviews: Commercial Drive itself is an interesting mixture of shops and restaurants. The #20 bus goes all the way to and from downtown or you can use it to connect with the 99B or 95 express bus lines to take you east and west. As with many of the in-town neighborhoods we saw in Vancouver, there is a commercial street with a residential zone just behind. Yes, you see some homeless people in the parks, on the public transportation, and in the streets. We never felt threatened or hassled. In fact, most people we met were friendly and helpful.

title: Funky Town
reviews: The funky part of Vancouver. Enjoy great cafe's, funky little shops and food from all around the world.

title: Poverty
reviews: To many bums asking for money and ywt they have cell phones? Like , wtf! is wrong here! Typical scammers!

title: Lots of restaurants
reviews: We came here as it was so close to our accommodation whilst staying in Vancouver. I have to say even though the area is full of restaurants and cafes, I found the quality to be less than the rest of Vancouver. Would I go out of my way to see this place? No unfortunately.

title: Really fun street
reviews: Lots of cool restaurants and shops, great vibe.  A bit away from the tourist areas.  Easily accessed by #20 bus or the Canada line from the City Center. Any kind of cuisine can be found here.

title: Vancouver’s best neighbourhood
reviews: It is such a shame that all the tourists flock to Gastown and miss what Vancouver is really all about. Oh well, we will just keep it to ourselves. ;)

title: One of the most diverse neighbourhoods in Vancouver
reviews: There are so many different small shops, cafes and restaurants. Commercial Drive is a great neighbourhood to walk for a few hours and discover a different part of Vancouver.

title: Fiercely independent, a bit gritty, but genuinely East Van.
reviews: Commercial Drive spans the neighbourhoods of Grandview and Woodland, and is much like the main drag of small-city Anywhere, Canada.  You could make comparisons to Toronto's Leslieville, or even some neighbourhoods in London England.The unique feature of Commercial Drive is the lack of big box or chain stores.  This is an area where even MacDonald's failed to survive, though there is one Starbucks and a MacDonald's right beside the SkyTrain station at Commercial & Broadway.  The storefronts are mostlly housed in buildings that made up the original 1910 era urban landscape, though sadly this is changing with the increasing pressure to build bigger, taller, and glitzy structures that would ruin the cache of "the Drive."   Nearly all of the businesses are unique enterprises, dominated by a large number of restaurants.  You like to eat?  This is certainly the place to come, with probably the greatest variety of quality eats and local atmosphere to be found anywhere in Vancouver.How do you get there?   Caution--parking is limited, especially on weekends in the evening.  Solution?  Transit is easy from downtown Vancouver.  Take the Skytrain to Commercial / Broadway station.  There are some good eateries in the immediate area--Bandidas to the south, and Broadway Station Sushi to the west (see my reviews).   While you're at it, you might even take in a bit of entertainment at the famous Rio Theatre, a quirky bastion of East Van counter-culture.  Nearly are two pubs, Toby's and St. Augustine's (60 taps!  Great food!).   Generally, if you walk north from Broadway, you will be immersed in foodie heaven, with choices like Jam Jar (Lebanese) and Sweet Greek (recommended!).If you have time, you can spend hours ambling between Broadway and Venables, and maybe a bit farther.  Bomber Brewery on Adanac St. comes to mind, as does the new kid on the block, East Van Brewery on Venables.If visiting, you might want to arrive a bit before noon, and spend the whole afternoon drinking in the ambiance.It's always good to come hungry.  You won't be disappointed.

title: It Changes, Yet Remains The Same
reviews: Over the years, some of the Italian restaurants have become sushi places, and the hippy joints have been replaced by hipster boutiques, but the atmosphere of counter-culture remains the same. Visitors to Vancouver may be reminded of Haight-Ashbury or Greenwich Village. A plethora of shops, cafes, places to sit and people watch. Take the skytrain to Commercial Drive and stroll a few blocks north.

title: Stroll The Drive
reviews: While visiting my family, I have walked the approximately 14 blocks of Commercial Drive many times. It has lots of coffee shops, ethnic eateries, meat, pastry, and grocery stores, as well as clothing, book, and gently used items stores. It is great to pop in to these small shops and sample their wares. I especially enjoyed the Italian bakery, sausage shop, Prato coffee shop, and Kisimoto  restaurant. I love seeing all the fruits and vegetables out on the sidewalk. So I encourage you to stroll “the drive” and enjoy your many “senses”.

title: I just didn't feel safe!
reviews: Been to this area three times because it does have interesting restaurant options, however it is one of those areas where you just don't feel very safe. Asked a few friends and most of them got the same feeling.

title: Really Cool Neighborhood. Great food at JAM!
reviews: Check this neighborhood out.  We dined at JAM and WOW!  Delicious.....the chef, Ash, is not only highly talented but fun to talk to.  I would highly recommend taking a walk a checking out the shops and restaurants.

title: Not Impressed
reviews: Unless we missed something, I'm not sure why anyone would go out of their way to get to Commercial Drive when there are so many other lovely places in Vancouver to see/visit. I really hate to be negative, so it pains me to write this review, but I'm really surprised by the hype that it received.

title: A bit scruffy, but delightful at the same time
reviews: Spent quite a while walking down commercial drive, a few interesting shops to browse around in. Filled with nice coffee shops, restaurants and bakeries. A few quirky shops that's fun to look at or buy a unique gift. The street is a bit busy for my taste.

title: Good Selection of Tempting Specialty Shops
reviews: We walked part of the drive in the rain this time. Our object was to pick up Italian Panini for supper. Lots of coffee shops, restaurants and other stores. Good bus transportation.

title: Hipster mix
reviews: Great are for fun little bars and great restaurants. This is an upcoming area for sure - where hipster meets original. Great area for vintages shopping as well.

title: Little Italy and More
reviews: Commercial Drive is a vibrant community commercial and social centre. Originally, the market street in an Italian neighbourhood, many of the delis, restaurants and shops still remain: Joe's coffee and La Grotto Formaggio to name a couple. Overlaid are the new boutiques that serve the newer residents: Barefoot Contessa, Blue Sky Clothing Company and Womyns Ware. As well, there are awesome eateries and drinking scenes: the Havana, Cafe Deux Soleils, and Caffe Roma to name only a few. There's more to explore on foot.

title: Bohemian blend
reviews: Commercial Drive has just about any kind of cuisine you can imagine. Tiny restaurants pack each block with the international tastes of the many ethnic groups and nationalities who have come to Vancouver. Lots of small shops and little grocery stores as well as bakeries round out the mix. A fun neighborhood with lots to see and taste.

title: long street
reviews: driveway to this street is very long and have lots of stores and restro bars. It is different street from usual downtown and good to go there.

title: Interesting area away from downtown Vancouver
reviews: Visited in September for dinner.  About a 15 minute taxi ride from downtown Vancouver.  Lots of dining places, but not too certain the quality of each.  Probably ok in the day, but took a cab at night since no one was walking around any longer.

title: Far from the city centre
reviews: We came here after one our walk, maybe it was because I was tired but I expected a street completely different. The shop were all similar and seamed the same of many decades ago. If it was nearer to the city centre it could grow and evolve with it.

title: A Diverse and "edgy" tho' Interesting street.
reviews: The street stretches about 10 blocks from 3rd to 13th streets.  There are many excellent bars and restaurants [many vegetarian] as well as "specialist Tobacco Shoppes".  In addition, there are many superb, large fruit and vegetable shops as well as amazing Bakeries!!  Perhaps more surprising, there are about 6 [or more] "Medical Marijuana" shops openly plying their trade!

title: Walk - Eat - Drink - Shop!
reviews: The Drive, in my opinion, is the best street to hang out and enjoy local multi-ethnic flavors. Lots of little shops and boutiques, MANY coffee shops, toy stores, books, high-end vinyl, silver, and of course: FOOD and LIVE MUSIC! Super easy to get to by bus or sky train... lots of awesome AirBnb in the area too! Nice view of downtown Vancouver from the park midway through the Drive. <3

title: Not bad
reviews: Lots of stores and places to eat. A little aged and many closed places. There are many other better places to visit in Vancouver

title: the Drive
reviews: Unique and interesting area, lots of great restaurants and fun things to do, fantastic bars, pubs and parks. Lots of organic food stores and a great community of friendly people.

title: Walking Into History
reviews: Always fun to be on Commercial.  You feel like you have steppedinto a Europeon town.  Small shops.  Caffe Calabria is fascinating!There are murals on the walls.  Statues everywhere and a fountain.  The family is so welcoming.

title: The real hippy neighborhood
reviews: We asked a few people where the chill hippy neighborhood would be and we got different answers... but I think we found int in Commercial Drive.  Lots of fun indie shops, but with a Starbucks thrown in.  Glad to have stumbled  to this end of town!

title: Coffee heaven
reviews: Little Italy at its finest. Coffee shops on every corner, great produce. One of a kind shops. a must stop.

title: Great for a long walk
reviews: Commercial was a surprise! We started in the beginning of the street and went all the way to find out a place to have lunch. We had a hard time choosing, cause everything seemed delicious and welcoming. The street remembers me a older neighborhood with traditional look, but with a diverse culinary for every mood. The whole area is very charming, even if you don't want to eat, is a great place to walk buy. But I promise you, you will want to eat.

title: East end slice of life
reviews: Used be known as Little Italy,  now so much more.Good shopping for food and many ethnic restaurants,  parking can be done off side streets, or the many exorbitantly priced City of Vancouver, meters, gobbling up yer $ til 10 pm 7 days a week.

title: Colourful murals and interesting shops and cafes
reviews: When arriving at the Skytrain station turn right to walk along Commercial Drive.  Walking the other way takes you away from the interesting shops

title: Awesome Walking Area With Eclectic Shops & Cafes
reviews: Commercial Drive Licorice Parlour was one of my stops as well as High Fidelity Salon, the Italian Store, Puff and the Malaysian store.  A great place to nibble, drink, walk and shop.  Take a rest at the beautiful outdoor park or the rec centre.

title: Excellent place
reviews: The Drive is a very good place to people watch, shop, have a coffee or eat out. Very iconic east side place

title: walk it
reviews: Great area to walk and enjoy the many funky shops and eateries. Parking can be a bit of a problem but with a keen eye you can get a spot. The skytrain is at one end of the drive and a short bus or walk will take you into the heart of the area. Many alternative residents live in this area, many homes off the drive old and interesting. People come here to enjoy the east side, shop and not have to be right downtown.

title: Restaurants night life smaller than city
reviews: But sort of hippie neighborhood fairly safe nice in summer time bars restaurants record stores use to Italian neighborhood small park high school hockey arena small one indoor swimming all kind of diff culture restaurants pretty nice place in summer time fairly busy accessible from downtown Van buses 2.75 around 30 min from granville street bus commercial drive bus way faster by sky train 15 min get off broad way stop walk north or towards shops more hippie area nice place to eat walk etc day night whatever in summer time

title: Time to Mow this Street Down & Give it a Facelift
reviews: I get that it's eclectic and artsy fartsy, but there are a lot of crazies on the Drive. I'd like to see a developer take this project on & give it a facelift. Good property- great views. Some of the restaurants are horrible, some are good; some are historic & should remain. I fancy the odd little shop. There are some pretty colourful people hanging around here. Bring your smart phone - you might just see a quasi opera singer & his dog or a gaggle of tattooed trailer trash burning up the drive. Ai ya yai.

title: The Drive
reviews: Home to hippies and people of all shapes,sizes creeds and lifestyles. Come with an open mind, grab a coffee and post up outside and watch. Very laid-back, chill vibe and a lot of people watching to be done on commercial drive.

title: Local Italian Neighborhood Experience
reviews: Commercial Drive is not for everyone but if you like a little adventure you will find some of the best Italian food, bakeries and Ice cream Vancouver has to offer. The food is very inexpensive and you get to enjoy the local hippie crowd. Commercial is a fun walk during the World Cup or for its famous yearly festivel, enjoy.

title: the Drive is still alive!!
reviews: Born and raised in the lower mainland and did many stops on commercial Drive. Was in  town for conference so did a drive through. The place is still great and some old stomping grounds. Only problem is parking now as it was crazy to find a spot to stop for lunch so just drove around and then went some where else for lunch

title: Hippie and faboloys!
reviews: Even if you are not from the 70's or speak Italian, Commercial Drive is the place to have a perfect coffee, enjoy a nice walk and have fun while dining in one of the hundreds restaurants along 'the drive', from Italian to Chinese, from a gym to grocery shopping. Come hungry!

title: Surprised
reviews: At first you may ask yourself what is this place and why I am here, but dont stop and keep walking. Slowly you get into it.I like the different atmosphere that Commercial Dr has, as compared to other attractive streets of Vancouver such as Yaletown or Robson St. I can not say it is more authentic, but it has something different. It is certainly a nice place for people watching and more importantly to find good ristrettos.Reachable by Sky Train from Waterfront, I recommend to pay it a visit.

title: My endearing and favourite neighbourhood for 30 years.
reviews: Listen you have not really been seen Vancouver til you have spent a day on "The Drive". This is this historically Italian and Portuguese neighbourhood of the city. It is more gentrified now, but resists any wholesale change. This is the the place where you an go to the pasta shop and hey are making the tortilini by hand, the cheese dealer has the best manchego cheese in the country, the Italian cafe has the best capuccino or late in the city, the best of the best is here. No major development, lots of old shop style merchants. If you can't find it on the drive it is probably not worth eating or drinking. It is an expensive area to have a home but the drive is just so Vancouver. Real people going about their lives, shopping for produce, cheese, baguettes, olives and wine. Me and my Italian friends meet here once a month for "slow food". Wine, then fifteen minutes later we look at the menu, we order our appetizer and finish it at out about the hour mark, more wine, the entree, and,we never walk out before two or two and a half hours. All good.

title: Edgy with Character
reviews: Commercial Drive is an interesting blend of Vancouver. It offers a wide assortment of bars and restaurants. In many ways it is similar to Main st. just a little more grungy. I think it adds character and charm adding to the appeal. Great place to stroll on a sunny day. Not a must see neighbourhood, but worth a visit.

title: For the Coffee Connoisseur
reviews: From Broadway st. down to Hastings st. is a coffee stroll as good as you will discover.This Little Italy district also hosts several fine bakeries as well as countless small restaurants There is also banks and liquor distibution along the way with an open market on certain weekend hours.When world cup soccer is on here is the place!

title: Great Eats and Shopping
reviews: Commercial Drive has a bit of everything. Great restaurants If you like Italian cuisine I would highly recommend "Arrivia"

title: people watching
reviews: This is a great neighbourhood to sit and people watch. I love coming and having a drink or a coffee and just watching the sites. All kinds of people roam the streets, and it's a hipster area for sure. Great entertainment always.

title: The of Italy
reviews: This is definately for Italian food lovers.  It would s like having Italy within a big metropolitan city

title: Gentrification is stepping in.... But still funky
reviews: Gentrification is stepping into the neighbourhood. New store fronts are popping up everywhere along the strip pushing some old established places out. But still plenty of delis, fruit and vegetable stands, boutiques, restaurants, coffee shops and more to peek into. Have fun.

title: Neat shops and great coffee shops and restaurants
reviews: We loved the vintage and thrift stores along Commercial.  We also loved the thai restaurants and coffee shops.

title: Funky Town
reviews: The Drive is full of character and it's an authentic neighbourhood with real people living their lives. Calabria Cafe is a shining example, owned by a long-standing Italian family. 3 generations work there! Good music, humour, coffee, this place defines Commercial Drive. As well the different shops along the Drive are quaint and unique. Arriva Restaurant is one of my favourites and I go back for the same thing every time: Antipasto followed by Spicey Prawns Linguini and beautiful home-made Focaccia Bread. You will have fun exploring! Try a game of pool at Joe's too!

title: International Street!
reviews: This is a street that everyone must see and experience, as it has that European flavour! It can be accessed by using Skytrain, great place for taking a stroll and enjoying some of the interesting shops or restaurants.

title: Viva Italia
reviews: This has become a great Italian cultural area that should not be missed.  I work nearby and frequently go to a café or for lunch.  Very busy during Italian days but full of Italian tastes and energy.  Lots of restaurants/cafe's to choose from.

title: Love Commercial Drive
reviews: Interesting and lots of character with some really great shops.This is a neighbourhood area with a unique blend of new and old.

title: A very interesting place to walk... all kinds of people to see.
reviews: The Drive is a place of unique character... not like the kind of tourist shopping of Robson Street. but there are some interestinglittleplaces... and a wide range of real Vancouverits to watch as you walk along.  it's a real Italian neighbourhood that has gradually changed to be more mixed/metropolitan, but you can still smell and tastes the old Italian. got to Fratelli's for baked goods and Famoso for Pizza.

title: Great Restaurant Street
reviews: There is an abundance of great restaurants down Commercial Drive, many of them are Italian and the prices are reasonable with great food and ambiance.

title: Cool Cafes & Character!
reviews: The Drive was previously dominated by Italian business back in the day, and still has part of that influence, particularly for all the incredible and countless coffee houses along the core of the strip, which is about 2kms.  There is an annual Italian Festival that still takes place in June or July.  This is a great place to shop for produce, grab some grub, stroll through the variety of shops and of course, enjoy a caffeinated beverage of your choice from one of many places that suit your taste!

title: Eclectc Mix
reviews: I love Commercial Drive for the variety - from dives to fine dining; from thrift to high end shoppes, from small variety stores to larger franchise type (think Home Hardware or PC grocery stores) - Commercial Drive has it all! Definitely worth the trip.

title: Waste of time do not bother
reviews: The place was dirty and sad. Pan handlers and druggies everywhere very rundown. There were coffee shops but we didn't like the environment and left immediately .

title: Very eclectic!
reviews: Commercial Drive is a long stretch of stores, shops, coffee shops, restaurants, etc. of a huge variety. Perfect place to spend a day exploring.

title: You"ll love exploring here!!
reviews: Now here's a neat street, full of shops to buy souvenirs, great little places to eat , markets where you can buy fresh vegetables, Italian deli, Frederick's where you can dance and lots of coffe places to have a coffee and dessert.

title: Grit meets Gentrified
reviews: Of all the neighbourhoods in Vancouver, this one feels the most real - real places and real people. Be prepared to meet all sorts on "the drive" and experience west coast life at its edgiest. No dress codes, lots of funky shops, multi-cultural food choices and quirky atmosphere. It's more than just a place to go and have coffee - it's a lifestyle!

title: You have to be adventurous
reviews: Get off the skytrain station at Commercial drive and start walking north up to may be the Britannia Community Center. There are tons of shops and restaurants along the way. Visit this place in the day time.

title: Don't miss it when in Van.
reviews: Got off the Skytrain at the wrong stop and stumbled onto Commercial Drive. Glad we did...all kinds of interesting shops, cafes and other eating places....don't miss it when you are visiting Vancouver.

title: So much culture, food and bars!
reviews: We stayed just off the Drive for a week and loved it! Countless food options and many, many bars. We ended up eating on the Drive the whole week, as there was that much good food available! To get to the CBD it's a short 3 stop train ride. Would definitely recommend.

title: Brilliant culture
reviews: Wonderful place to walk and have coffee. Lots to see and do...reasonably priced and great night life!

title: Food to eat and seafood to die for.
reviews: Besides some great restaurants and a seafood market, this area also brags the best dimsum in town.park your car and take a stroll. Great food and awesome dessert cafes, and whether it's after theater or after church it is a win-win location. (Skytrain nearby)

title: Istayed here in this neighborhood twice now and love it.
reviews: Food coffee shops boutiques and all kinds of people.Better than main st.Colourful and cool.Parks and leafy streets and sky train,

title: Nice old school area
reviews: We drove and walked thru this area.  Older (Classic) buildings with shops and cafes.  Very LBGT friendly which is great to see!  Loved our time.

title: Yawn... if this is on your place to visit, there is something wrong...
reviews: Billed as a creative locale, a great place to live and wonderful people... People are people, but you could score some meth in an alley way, or get asked for money outside a shop. There are lots of stores along commercial selling junk wrapped up in trendy colours and furniture that has be rescued from dead relatives. Self hypes itself to keep the illusion going, don't fall for it.

title: Food
reviews: There are many restaurants there, so it's ideal to stay in this area while visiting Vancouver. You can easily take the skytrain to downtown. When you don't stay in the area of Commercial Drive, I wouldn't bother to visit.

title: Gotta Love THE DRIVE
reviews: This is a great place to wander  to browse  to shop for antiques  retro clothing  staples, current trends,  great people watching great coffee shops - where Hollywood tends to go - great great bistros to Nosh - good food good service excellent people watching

title: Gritty, Artsy and Cheap Delicious Ethnic Eats!
reviews: My favourite true neighbourhood, this strip of fantastic casual restaurants, craft beer pubs and super funky shops is really a wonderful place to hang out with the grittier side of vancouver. Yes you will see panhandlers, but you will often see (and hear) absolutely fantastic street musicians. There's a nice park (Grandview) that is a gathering place for the locals. You may be able to pick up inexpensive items for sale by impromptu vendors.. CDs and jewelry, etc. The hippie culture is alive and well! You may also get to see people playing bike polo.. in the tennis courts on the west side of the park... amazing! The ethnic restaurants are the big draw.. there are many many and they are generally very inexpensive.. there are several really great craft beer places that have so many beers to choose from you are sure to get your fill of delicious! Enjoy, and be happy!

title: Coffee bars
reviews: Italian neighborhood with… yes, espresso’s and cappuccino’s, made Italian style in one of the dozens of trendy coffee bars.

title: a must destination for strolling, coffee, dinner etc
reviews: one of Vancouver's true jewels.  If you are a local and do not visit on a regular basis, summer or winter, you are really missing out.

title: old vancouver
reviews: nie part of town had a real feel of a older vancouver no high rise all building fixed at no more than 5 storeys really nice way to see how vancouver used to be before the multi story blocks took over

title: Gr8, No high rise apartments!
reviews: Just like 20 yrs ago! Funky shops, cafes, gr8 vibe & no glass tower apts!! Lived here in late 70s and it's still an intact neighbourhood unlike so much of Vancouver; parking bit of a hassle, but stick with it.. The stroll up/down Commercial well worth it! Try Andy's Breads-lower end towards Hastings- for best German bread & pastries!

title: nice place to stroll
reviews: Would be ever better if sidewalk were larger, more trees planted  and road narrower and reserved for buses, street cafe should have more outdoor sitting space

title: This place has changed so much, but what makes it special is still there
reviews: For as long as I can remember, this has been the restaurant district with neat trendy restaurants and shops carrying cheap exotic stuff you'll find nowhere else. I was there when the place was crammed with Italian restaurants and bakeshops that served the best pasta and pastries in town. Some are still there, but now it's more cafes and mini restaurants. I don't like the fact that common Mcfranchises (like Tim Horton's and Starbucks) invaded but hey everyone has to make a living.I do love the used bookstores in this part of town and the record stores selling vinyl gold. Those are new, but very welcome.It's always been a place to walk, browse, and eat on a sunny day. Give yourself a couple hours.

title: walkabout
reviews: It's coined Little Italy, not sure why, it is a stretch of some trendy shopping, coffee shops, specialty stores, parks, residential area. You could spend a morning or afternoon wandering and enjoying

title: Bohemian Vibe in Eastern Vancouver
reviews: Commercial Drive is well removed from the main shopping areas downtown.  You'll get a good taste of more workaday Vancouver here.  At one end is the Croatian Cultural Centre, which hosts many great, funky events.  There are high end flea markets here every month, craft shows, concerts, etc.  It's definitely worth checking the Cultural Centre's calendar if you're coming to town.As you walk further along Commercial Drive, you will find many coffee houses, vintage clothing stores, used book stores, ethnic shops.  It is home to Kishimoto Sushi - one of the best sushi joints in the city.It is not uncommon to see film crews along Commercial Drive.  Vancouver is a hub for tv production.

title: SO MUCH TO EAT
reviews: We stated at an air BnB about 10 min drive from Commercial and we could have gone here every night for dinner. There are so many restaurant and different diverse options to eat.

title: Fav spot to hangout
reviews: You will not find any corporations on Commercial drive and thats what makes it so great. Commercial drive offers every kind of business imaginable but is mainly Cafes and restaurants. We love to come here for food and drinks on any given day during the week. Come prepared to do some people watching and enjoy a great patio.

title: My name is Drive, Commercial Drive.
reviews: Commercial Drive, as Drive addressed by locals, is Little Italy of Vancouver. Italian immigrants began to settle here and surrounding areas around the Great War. Later, immigrants from another Latin langrage country, Portugal, began to establish their community around here, too. Today, the Drive accomodates various cultures and ethnic groups, and pretty much has the most live music venues out of downtown area.

title: Want Ethnic Vancouver?
reviews: "The Drive" as it has been known for Decades . . . is as "Ethnic" as you can get in Vancouver! Dry weather is best, 'cuz there is LOTS of walking. . .  take your camera. . . MANY unusual curios to get a pix. . . Food. . . Just get an "Appy" at the places that interest you. . . You can NEVER eat all the food they serve!

title: Foodie heaven
reviews: A couple of hours strolling Commercial Drive picking up great selection of groceries and import foods, visiting the Italian bakeries and delis and getting some really great coffee is my idea of a perfect afternoon. There are also some good hoe decor shops and a few funky clothing stores to check out, and all the wild, weird and wonderful people you could hope to see in a few city blocks.

title: One of Vancouver's great neighbourhoods!
reviews: A great, character laden street with food and wares of many kinds from many countries. The city's oldest and best cheese store (La Grotta dela Fromaggio), excellent green grocers, great classic coffee shops, restaurants of every nationality, great pizzerias, housewares, garden supplies, hardwares, gelato.... it's all there and makes for a great stroll.pizzerias, pubs, clothing, collectibles

title: Be forewarned. There's a topless elderly woman roaming and preaching.
reviews: Spent a few hours here yesterday.  The naked woman's language will be offputting to children. Commercial Drive has some gems. Italian shoe store real leather with great value and craftmanship. Greek grocery store amazing. Gypsy bacon/ meat store those in the know come from far. Italian coffee shops and bakeries. Hungarian bakery no longer run by Hungarians but just as authentic.  Plenty of options for eating.

title: Diverse and fun
reviews: I love this area it's just got so much to offer whether it's a nice lunch, coffee with friends, dinner or date night. I've gotten a great tattoo an East Van Inc, had lots of fun at Grandview lanes bowling, a great night playing board games at the Stormcrow and a delicious dinner at Havana! There's a lot to offer with a genuine atmosphere

title: Love it! Dream Cycle and Joes Coffee
reviews: "on the drive" locals say, something is always happening - the people are so authentic they've become an attraction! :) If you wanna build a custom bike at dream cycle, talk bikes or fix a bike you'll have a REAL experience here - and Joe's REAL italian cappuccino? Mmmm... + my gr daughter was winked at - she thought it was awkward, we told her it was just Italian! Ha Thank you for an awesome time!

title: funky part of Vancouver that hasn't been gentrified
reviews: I've lived close to Commercial Drive all my adult life, I love coming here for walks....in the morning for coffee......yes okay...I go to Starbucks....not the little Italian coffee shops....it's not a crime!!!!!  I love Fratelli bakery.  There are tons of little restaurants for a bit to eat.  Now that I've moved out of the area, I feel so homesick when I go to the drive.

title: Great for food and shopping!
reviews: One of my favourite areas in Vancouver to come and spend the day shopping and eating! The stores are great if you're into a vintage-y alternative kind of look. There's a few great consignment shops and import places for cheap jewelry and such. The food is diverse, and there's something for everyone. Havana is an awesome place for food! TONS of coffee shops, a nice park for the kids to play. VERY family friendly area!

title: Not a staged tourist spot, this is genuine!
reviews: Spend an afternoon on the "drive" and you will be making memories! Lots os spots to stop, eat, browse and relax.  A multicultural gem on vancouvers east side.  This is a place to enjoy and savour! Some great stores that sell reasonably priced artworks.

title: good times!
reviews: so many tasty treats and eats, shops, and such.   I love the drive.  I highly suggest memphis BBQ!!!!!!

title: Nice "trendy" walk
reviews: Lots of little stores and restaurants. Very hippie / cool bars - people there. Nice food stores also. It is something to see if you go to visit Vancouver.

title: Lots of interesting shops
reviews: Commercial Drive is Vancouver's "Little Italy" although the area also has great mix of other European and Asian influences.  This is one of the best areas to experience genuine Italian food and drink.  There are numerous coffee shops and stores selling pastries and other imported foods.  The area has very much of a party atmosphere during soccer tournaments and is great to immerse yourself in.  The whole area is within easy reach of public transport (probably best as parking can be limited) and is an ideal place to spend half a day wandering the shops.  Worth the time!

title: Very multicultural
reviews: It's amazing after all these years, born and bred here, that coming here still brings joy and happiness to the Drive.Lots to see, do and eat.Especially in the summer, when everyone's licking gelato.  Or whenever there's a soccer event lol.Safe too, not rowdy, for sure lots of locals too.

title: Great area to stay in Vancouver!
reviews: I did an Airbnb on East 2nd St and it was Awesome.....Mel & Dean Cooper (look them up).....really cool/modern/contemporary style apartment! Easily accessibility from Commercial drive station to city!! Wonderful restaurants and coffee houses: e.g JJ Bean's/Prado etc!

title: Eclectic and fun
reviews: I love shopping on this street!  There are lots of ethnic grocery stores and shops offering things that are difficult to fine elsewhere and at prices you won't pay in fancy shops.  Also lots of small eateries.

title: A nice slice of life in Vancouver
reviews: Get away from the glitzy glass towers and waterfront and come to funky Commercial Drive where real people hang out.  Lots of small boutiques, book stores, bars, coffee shops, and surprisingly good restaurants.  This is very much a local residential area, not to compete with fancy Robson Street, but it is an authentic Vancouver neighborhood with a lot to offer.  Easy access via SkyTrain.

title: the Drive is nice, but not nearly as nice as when I was a kid
reviews: Commerical Drive (the Drive as it was known to the locals) is a pleasant neighborhood on the East side of Vancouver.  I used to live in the Grandview community (just 2 blocks to the West of the Drive), in days past I can remember that my parents never locked the back door..............alas such is not the practice in metro Vancouver any longer.  In today's world the Drive is infiltrated with ethnic restaurants and coffee houses.

title: Neighbourhood Best
reviews: The Drive is truly a Vancouver icon.  Nightlife, day life, shopping, eating, drinking, shopping; is there any reason to go anywhere else?

title: Funky Town
reviews: Lots of families love to move into this area. It used to be Italian central and in many ways still is. Commercial Street is overrun by locals on the weekend. Parking is tough to locate and there are many wonderful stores to purchase authentic olive oils etc at decent prices. There are some wonderful espresso bars that are still frequented by old Italian men sitting around arguing passionately about current affairs. Definitely worth a visit as it is only partially touristy

title: Kind of ok, but without much character
reviews: While I lived near this area for 6 months, I did most of my shopping in Commercial Drive, I could get most I needed so it was very useful. I was a bit surprised though how the locals said it was such a wonderful street. I mean, compared to any street back home in Amsterdam, it has no character. Barely there was any pleasantly looking architecture or nice looking feature (I had that feeling in most of Vancouver). Everything seems to have been built without any creativity or eye for quality. Everything seemed worn out, for example when you open a door of a shop, not rarely it feels very flimsy and you will hear the class ratteling in the frame. Quite laughable. The storage racks in shops often look like 30 years old. The ATM's which look like they were bought from some dump store in Korea (eventhough I used them, they didn't seem very trustworthy to me). Went to a couple of bars and restaurants, they were quite decent. Although, I always had to curb my humour with the staff. They seem to be overly polite and can take some jokes too personal. That didn't help much to improve the lack character of this street.I don't want to sound too negative though, if you are in Vancouver, you can probably get all you need in this street, just don't expect much beyond that.

title: Love to walk this street
reviews: This is a great street to stroll down and take in the sites and people. There are places to eat, parks, grocery stores, yoga, shops, cafes, pubs, pretty much everything you could want. Love coming here on a summer day and eating on one of the many great patios on the drive.There is also Commercial Days where they limit cars from driving down and people stroll up and down the streets. Preety fun times. Also if there is ever a big soccer event ou can usually find somewhere to sit and enjoy the game with some food or drinks.

title: Seedy freak show
reviews: Great coffee bars and eateries but sometimes a little too real life.  Drug addicts and low life's abound.  Don't get me wrong I lived on "The Drive" for 17 years but it was tiresome being harassed by panhandlers and druggies for your change all the time.  I go back and enjoy the adventure but i am glad i moved away.Commercial is still a great place to grab a coffee and stroll around......but.

title: Coffee shops and delis, a good stroll
reviews: Now becoming trendy, but great italian roasters and tratorrias near the north end. A nice 2 hour afternoon stroll.

title: Edgy but Kool
reviews: Commercial used to be the backbone of the Italian and Portuguese communities in Vancouver, which have largely moved on although there are still several cafés, eateries and stores which cater to and carry their cultural products. It's best to stay on the main drag at night as there is a local youth gang which hangs out around the Skytrain Station at Broadway and Commercial, at the park 3 blocks North of First St, and in the neighborhood behind (West of) the park. When you reach Venables St, it's all bad on both sides down to the harbor and it's all residential so there is nothing to see or buy. Here are government subsidized projects and cheap housing where conditions exist which promotes restless kids and desperate acts. On Commercial itself you will find a harmonious and eclectic mixture of immigrant cultures offering everything from soup to nuts. There are stores of all kinds and extractions, restaurants, some notable but most not, cafés, boutiques, specialty shops, hippie food, services of all kinds, a regular Canadian neighborhood bar along with a dozen other fancy and semi fancy "public alcohol dispensaries", and a couple of legal marijuana ones, art galleries, fast foods galore, 2 pool halls, one fancy movie theater on Broadway at Commercial and anything else you might think of including an Italian Armory. Wonder around the neighborhood during the day all you want, it's safe and beautiful just to the East of Commercial and 3-4 blocks past the bridge over the Skytrain tracks, and there are some great cityscapes visible down from the Park 3 blocks North of First St.

title: Trendy and Hipater !!!!
reviews: It is a great variety of people and shops.  Friendly atmosphere clean and eclectic. Many services available.

title: Pretty hyped up for what it is but still worth seeing
reviews: Before moving to Vancouver everybody who had been here had recommended it as the 'place to go to' and it was described as the 'Toronto Kensington market' or the 'London's Camden Town' of Vancouver. We found it was incomparable. It is quite nice and the shops and cafes have an element of quirkiness to them and it is cool that it is mostly independent places but we would personally say that there isn't much atmosphere here - it is just a row of shops placed along a busy road. It is still worth a visit though for a place of interest outside the city centre and it has a less commercial vibe (despite the name).

title: Great place to wander and have coffee
reviews: All kinds of mostly boutique shops with all kinds of stuff for sale, from produce to antiques to novelties.  Many coffee shops (including the dreaded Starbuck's, but there's much, MUCH better coffee to be had at the non-franchise places) wide selection of restaurants, overall a kind of bohemian atmosphere.

title: Great Coffee, delicious panini, and so much character
reviews: I would recommend to anyone visiting Vancouver in the summer, to come check out Commercial Drive.  There is so much life in the neighbourhood - quirky, interesting characters, delicious espresso bars, cafes, restaurants and a beautiful mix of art and culture.....

title: Funky Fun
reviews: "The Drive" is a great place for people watching. Some people might think it a bit 'sketchy' but it is definitely an experience. Best coffee in town is here--the Continental. And of course lots of pizza choices. It is really bonkers football time, everyone comes out in their colours. If you're into second hand and vintage stores, great selections north of 1st Ave.

title: One of the best places to visit if you don't know what you feel like eating!
reviews: There are so many restaurants on Commercial that if you don't know what you feel like having that day, you could just walk down the street and pick any restaurant along the way. There's so many options and so many great places here that you really can't go wrong!

title: BUZZING WITH PEOPLE
reviews: The Commercial Drive I am reviewing is located between Broadway and about one kilometer south of 1st Avenue.   We stay near here whenever we visit Vancouver because our relatives live near here.  There are a lot of people walking around on the sidewalks most of the time -- people of many ethnic groups.   Most of The Drive consists of small businesses selling their products.   There are about ten food or grocery stores in this location -- mostly Mom and Pop operations.  Many advertise themselves as organic, and it seems like they are trying to "out-organic" each other.  (I myself do eat a lot of organic vegetables.)  There are also about at least a half dozen coffee shops in this vicinity.  I wouldn't make a special visit to  this area, but it's enjoyable to be part of the energy of the people there if you're nearby.

title: people - places - and real cool things
reviews: All Good!!!When I lived nearby the drive, i took all the restaurants for granted.   Now i find myself wanting to move back.

title: Great visit
reviews: A fun stroll thru a truly diverse area of cultures. Take a few hours and enjoy the many restaurants,coffee shops and boutique stores. Truly Vancouvers little Italy.

title: Like strolling thru this area
reviews: Great coffee spots, eateries with reasonable prices.  Buses very busy thru this area.  Some funky shops and Italian shops with pastas and sauces.

title: Nice day for a walk
reviews: Commercial Dr is a nice street to go for an afternoon walk. Lots of great restaurants, funky shops,  coffee shops and books stores.Spend nothing or a little something for everyone.

title: Everything one needs
reviews: Love the area! Spending a week staying on the drive and love having everything I could need within walking distance and with a wierd flare.

title: The Charm Is Disappearing
reviews: While there are still a few spots on "The Drive" that manage to keep the vibe and alt culture of the past, it is slowly becoming gentrified and hipsterfied. When its tough to find a decent Italian restaurant in what was formerly the Italian area, you know things aren't necessarily changing for the better! Watch out for rude panhandlers!

title: Escape the city and experience the drive!
reviews: hippies,hipsters...hamsters? you can find all of that and a great cup of coffee when you visit "the drive". queer friendly businesses and locally made products up and down the strip inside store and out on the street if your lucky enough to catch some of the talented artist who sell there art on the street! must do and see while in vancouver!

title: Full of character & culture!
reviews: I love coming to this area when visiting Vancouver! It reminds me of Kensington Market in Toronto, but just a long street. I find it has such a raw cultural Influence and true hippy vibe. It's one of few areas of Vancover where you feel culture and non of those expensive high-end boutiques that you would find along West 4th.Fab vintage stores, along with Latin shops/restaurants, cannabis culture stores,  Caribbean restaurant etc... It just has a spark that I haven't felt in any other part of the city.

title: Interesting street
reviews: Such an exciting street with lots of shops and restaurants. Something for everyone and dog friendly.

title: Low budget bohemian vibe
reviews: If patchouli and vegan are your thing, you'll like the bohemian vibes of Commercial.  It's not my thing and although there are a few good restaurants worth checking out, it's just too rough around the edges for me to go out of my way to hang there.

title: They call it the drive
reviews: Nice in summer time lots of Restsurant s small park more of hippie area east side bit of a way from Center of van either get there by Bline express bus on broadway street or take sky train fastest way going towards metro town direction very fast by sky train 2.75$ for a ticket or get all day pass for around 10$ for buses sky train at a Safeway store or 7-11 store anyways commercial drive is nice place for small Restsurant s buy fruit stores small shopping stores

title: East Van Cultural Centre
reviews: Commercial drive is a real slice of life. If you can appreciate a little colour outside the lines, this neighbourhood is worth exploring. You are more likely to strike up a conversation on a street corner or in one of the many independent coffee shops here than most other neighbourhoods in Vancouver. The cultural flavour is predominantly Italian and Portuguese. To get a real feel for this, visit during World Cup.

title: The most ecclectic and cool street in Vancouver!
reviews: Known as "The Drive", Commercial Drive has everything except pretension. Every and all ethnic quisines are represented. Every type and colour of person, hair, clothing and tats. Often live music. More patios popping up for people watching. Always plenty to see and do. Great gelato. Coffee shop corner central at Commercial and 2nd. The Drive has something for everyone.

title: great street and worth a visit
reviews: Great street with nice coffee shops, some good italian food stores (actually the cheapest place i ve found to buy some good olive oil and prosciutto), some good bars and always something to see. Worth a visit while you are in vancovuer.

title: Great place to visit
reviews: I call this Little Italy. Amazing restraunts, bakeries and coffee shops. During soccer season Commercial Dr. is the place to be Enjoy the atmosphere and great upbeat happy people.

title: Another View of Vancouver
reviews: The eastern part of downtown Vancouver has grown into a very interesting neighborhood. Reconstructed townhouses and apartment buildings, small shops and diverse restaurants have sprouted for an influx of new residents. Not too far away from center city, Commercial Drive is accessible by train, bus or taxi (or a long walk). It is worth exploring because of the absence of large crowds and hordes of tourists. Good coffee spots on the Drive.

title: Ethnic eateries and more
reviews: Noisy, bustling street.  Great people watching.   Coffee shops and boutiques galore plus a few medical  mj dispensaries.  Check out Canterbury Tales used books and next door's record store.

title: Little italy
reviews: I love commercial drive for its italian eateries. Famosas and marcellos are the best! Love all the little shops, delis and italian coffe and gelato cafes

title: Trency street in Vancouver's East Side
reviews: Lots of boutique shops, lots of interesting looking Vancouver residents as well as tourists.  Coffee available at many small shops, Italian style.  One restaurant specializes in rare, expensive mezcal (many available on the menu)

title: from Pizza to Salsa Dancing!
reviews: For a bit of bohemian rhapsody you have to venture down the "drive' - I love Havana's - Marios and countless others that I got a chance to try! at night check out Frederico's night lounge!

title: Funky part of town with great restaurnat selection and bars
reviews: Funky part of town with many ethnic restaurants and lots of barsGreat for Italian foodNice bar scene

title: Worth a look
reviews: We went out to Commercial drive by skytrain, one of the first things I noticed was how much cheaper fruit and vegetables were than in downtown Vanvouver. We called into Canterbury tales (a book shop) they sell new and second hand books there and for all book lovers it's a must.

title: Reality Check... Refuses to Gentrify
reviews: About as down to Earth as it gets. Worth the walk from Venables to Broadway and back. Old guys speaking Italian in front of coffee shops (I swear it looked like a scene from Sapranos). Homeless. Skateboarders. Asian restaurants. Bars. Real markets. Not a chain store in site. Just a nice urban feel. And basically NO tourists.

title: The "Drive"
reviews: The drive is eclectic. Hipsters, the homeless, suburbanites who have moved to East Van. You'll find it all. Great Italian and Indian food, great Affogato, and coffee. Several fresh fruit/veg markets and a great Lonnie store!!

title: Bandidos Vegetarian Mexican Restaurant
reviews: Just a block from the skytrain my Mom & I saw this restaurant was full of people, the prices were reasonable so we thought we'd try it for lunch.  At first we didn't know it was a meatless Mexican Restaurant. There was a man sitting at the table beside us who left because he wanted a meat Buritto.  My mom at 87 is not a big meat eater anymore, but I do like my meat. We decided to order one baked burrito baked in a ceramic dish with cheese melted on top. It was absolutely delicious and I didn't miss the meat at all! I've been to Mexico a dozen times and it was definitely as good as any authentic Mexican Restaurant! And it was enough for two for lunch! I would definitely go back again when visiting Vancouver.

title: Funky bohemian
reviews: Funky hip neighborhood with excellent restaurants. Boho chic with edginess. A neighbor of old run down mixed with new up and coming.

title: It's OK. Not Great. Not Bad. Just OK.
reviews: I haven't been to "The Drive" since the mid 1990's. Back then it was small mostly Italian restaurants that rocked during European league soccer tournaments.I wandered the street on Sunday. It was well, sleepy as Sunday would be. And there are some cool anomalous restaurants that are worth a look. But overall it's kinda dull..fruit and veggie stores, more ethnic restaurant options than years ago. But not quite the cultural experience the street is promoted as.Give it a try. It's worth the walk on a pleasant day. If you don't get out much, it will be a wonderful adventure. If you've traveled, well, it's a bit of a yawn.

title: nice place to see
reviews: very trendy lost to see and do old style flavor very ethnic. Lots of shops to choose from not a was of time at all a nice walk

title: Finky & Fun Neighborhood
reviews: A bit off the beaten path but a fun bohemian neighbor with microbrews and pubs. We enjoyed bomber brewery.

title: Vibrant
reviews: Commercial Drive is a long street full of shops, bars, cafe's, eateries and restaurants. It is a busy and colourful street and a good place to visit for any of the above and savour local life. In fact I preferred it to Gastown. We did eat in Absinthe Bistro which I do recommend but you would need to book.

title: Best people-watching in Vancouver
reviews: I chuckled when I read the reviews that described Commercial Drive as "dirty".  Have these reviewers been to - oh, I dunno - ANY OTHER CITY IN THE WORLD?!  So if the sight of a discarded cigarette butt makes you shriek, then avoid The Drive.  But, by all means, check it out if you'd like to experience:- The best people-watching in Vancouver.- Great food from all cultures.- Live music.- Vintage and original arts and fashion.- A diverse neighbourhood where people are tolerant, relaxed, and easy to talk to.

title: Nice Area
reviews: I haven't been shopping on Commercial Drive in years, but pass by it on my way to downtown, for appointments, meet up with friends...I've shopped on that street at a Women's Fetish Store years ago.

title: Good Times
reviews: I love this place!!!! Its bustling high energy and fun. I have been a few times and there is a lot to do and see. Whether its dining at one of its many restaurants, looking through the vintage shops or sitting in a park watching the world go by. It is easy to get to by public transport or by car from downtown. I was lucky enough to be there for halloween and also attended a day of the dead festival with street band and performers. It is truly a place of fun, exploration and good times so if you have a spare day, afternoon or evening do yourself a favour and check it out.

title: The Drive has a lot to offer!
reviews: I lived in the Commercial Drive area for over a year and loved every minute! This street knows how to entertain. Street parties, bars with bands, cheap food, colourful locals and Trout Lake nearby for a swim. So accessible by Public Transport also. This was my favourite place in Vancouver! Grab a Sunday Caesar and do some relaxed people watching.

title: Meet little italy
reviews: Here we have a diverse area of cultures and one in particular that we truly love Italian foods. Great pastas to every thing Italian so tasty and authentic.

title: Car Free Day on Commercial Drive
reviews: On father day we decided to go to Car free day. It was a nice sunny day to stroll on the street and see the festivities'. There is everything from Italian food to Sushi, Wrestling ring, cloths for sale, music and performers  and everything else from A to Z. Nice place to go for an afternoon walk and people watch.

title: Food and drink to be had...highly recommend Havana for brunch eats ;)
reviews: There is a lot to see, and good food from one end to the other and shops to wander around in.  A walkable street.

title: Different and Vibrant
reviews: Commercial Drive gives you a little different flavour of Vancouver. The "Drive" as locals like to call it is a stretch of road surrounded by culture, music and a variety of interesting stores. This is a very different scene to downtown's conservative Robson Street and is worth a visit if you are looking for something a little less mainstream during your visit.  Have a great trip!

title: Eclectic and colourful
reviews: Commercial Drive is unequally in the Lower Mainland for the diversity it provides. Many restaurants offerings are often unique and not to be found anywhere else in town. No big box stores here and expect for some of the big name coffee chains, small one-of-a-kind establishments. A Vancouver must-see.

title: The best place to explore in Vancouver
reviews: Commercial Drive is the best place in my view to explore in Vancouver. It has vintage shops, a good selection of restaurants esp in terms of representation of different cultures. We had Ethiopian here and Caribbean, as well as Tunisian and El Salvadorian. It has a buzz and good vibe and is popular with the young. It does however have a bit of an edge to it, as you can see by the sheer number of medicinal marijuana shops. Still worth checking out in my view.

title: Fun Bohemian Style Neighborhood
reviews: This is an interesting neighborhood with the main street have so many different nations restaurants, boutiques, grocers and much more.  It has a large counter-culture demographic, including political activists, lesbians, hippies, punks, and artists. Lots of painted murals on many of the business walls and even a few weed shops even though they are technically illegal. Great place to talk a walk, grab a bite to eat and people watch.

title: awesome!
reviews: This street is awesome, with all kinds of restaurants and shops on it! Some great thrift stores too, don't remember their names

title: Not really a tourist destination...
reviews: ...Which is why I love it. For years I didn't get why people loved the drive so much, but that was because I lived and worked downtown. Moving out of the monoculture it still has taken a while to adjust. There are beggars. There are poor people. There are a fair few people who should probably not drink so early in the day and yes you can always smell someone smoking something 'fragrant'. But there is a fantastic community that lives and works together that is culturally, ethnically and socially diverse. That means you have a complete range of shops and services along the drive, and after a year there I am still discovering new gems all the time. Coming from London, it reminds me of Hackney in that sense. Not overly pretentious (you will find posers in all of Vancouver of course), it has a strong sense of heritage but not in a precious way - the Drive is constantly evolving. Come for great restaurants, fun bars with live music, excellent cheap grocery shopping and some fancy Italian coffee shops and ludicrously priced cheese emporiums. Get a haircut or a tattoo and just enjoy being in a neighbourhood that is relaxed and fun.

title: Trendy unique Vancouver scene
reviews: Looking for something different. Try a walk on Commercial Drive. Lots of ethnic sights. Easy to veto with the Sky Train. Reminds me of Kitsalano in the 60's or Gastown in the 70's.

title: Great Neighborhood!
reviews: If you are interested in off beat and unique hang outs, visit the Commercial Dr. District.  Great coffee bars, diverse eateries and Mivintage Shop for wonderful vintage rags!It's a unique setting for a town that has grown to be to "too generic"!

title: Safer walk during the day.
reviews: Commercial is an eclectic street with lots of neat shops and restaurants.Lots to do and see. Seems to cater to a more hippie/hipster/homeless crowd.Expect to have moments of "What's that smell?" when walking around. Could be garbage, or urine, or both.

title: Needs to be cleaned up
reviews: Very dirty and sad. Although, some of the coffee shops are lovely with excellent coffee and treats. Mostly, the neighbourhood feels very rundown.

title: See It And Believe It
reviews: I had the pleasure to walk the entire "Drive" which quite adequately sums up Canada for me. Commercial Drive in Vancouver is a true representation of a Metropolitan city. I could not help myself but look into every shop on both sides.  It has Everything from doped beggars, intellectual types, university students, yuppies, hippies, cannabis shops, high end retailers, a very big pet shop, an ice rink, library, coffee shops, Italian Restaurants, Spanish takeaways, 100s of cafes and eateries, pubs you name it. It is all there! It is a feast for your eyes and taste buds. You can sit on a shop window and day dream or take a walk and be accosted all the way through the entire "Drive" by beggars, street vendors, buskers, Dogs! OMG I have never seen so many people with dogs! But I loves evry minute of it. Will do it all over.

title: Commercial Drive in vancouver
reviews: commercial drive in Vancouver is a good outing.   the easiest way to do it is to start at Broadway skytrain station.   It is a unique place.  There is lots to see and do.  There is a huge number of coffee shops in the area..  There are an incredible number of  restaurants from a varied background..  bring a camera as people watchingis  bonus here.

title: Diverse
reviews: A very diverse place with so many different restaurants and cafes serving lots of different ethnicity's food with great bars and patios.. Fun events throughout the year like car free day and Italian day. Also great arts scene with comedy nights shows and movie screenings.

title: Yuppie Hipsters, Drugged out Beggars, Some Greengrocers.
reviews: I lived here for a time, but now I only come back if I need some cheap fruit and veg.  The whole strip just gives me the creeps now.  Lots of beggars crying poverty, yet somehow they have the funds to smoke drugs and drink in the parks all day, when they aren't taking up half the sidewalk.  At least one guy has a knife in his hands at all times- for the arts and crafts he sometimes carves, I'm sure.  Dope is openly sold outside the post office; convenient for some I suppose.On the other side of the coin are the Yuppie Hiptser types who thrive on the gluten free organic vegan paleo hand-picked by Tibetan virgins coffee shops and fishmongers who will tell you the name of the captain of the boat where this overpriced fish was caught, but I ramble.  If you're familiar with Vancouver, the Drive is kind of like Robson Street, with slightly less known brands (but the same high prices).  But hey, if people want to spend $32 (plus tax and tip) for a thin crust pizza who am I to be critical.Be careful if you're driving, as the denizens of this area tend to walk into traffic as is they're daring you to hit them.On the plus side, there are a few good takeaways and fruit and veg shops left, though I'd advise browsing them all to see which has the better prices or quality on any given day.Tacky, certainly.  Funky, maybe- but not cheap.

title: Good spot for a coffee
reviews: This is a great place to meet up with some friends, hang out, walk the streets, sit down at one of the many coffee shops and people watch for awhile. The Commercial Skytrain Station is usually crowded with people, they have a bunch of stores/shops to eat at, banks nearby. People do their own thing on Commercial, and its best to let them be.

title: Love it here, but it grows on you..
reviews: So, I visited commercial drive for the first time in 2011, and I was indifferent to it."WHY would I come here? Kensington Market (my current home) is SO MUCH COOLER."In 2012, I found myself moving away from the Market in Toronto, and to Vancouver. It was really a coin toss between Kits and Commercial drive. We picked commercial drive because we wanted to be around the queer culture.Now, The Drive isn't somewhere I'd put on a "must-see" list if you're on a tight budget. You don't "see" the Drive like you would Kensington Market in Toronto, or some of the other neighbourhoods in Vancouver (like Kits). You "experience" The Drive.There's not much to "see," but there's lots to experience.Grab a coffee in a cafe, and strike up a conversation with someone. Sit in the park, and join in on someone's jam session.Find someone you think looks cool in the park ("cool" is subjective - this is one of the most diverse places I've ever been, and you will find someone who meets your unique brand of cool in gradview park). Tell anybody in the park that it's your first time on The Drive, and they'll probably let you hang out with them.Grab food from all over the world (which is notably absent in Vancover, compared to Toronto, in many other parts of the city).Walk around the streets, and check out the amazing backyard farms. Ask someone to show you around. They will.If you have time, spend at least 2-3 days here. If you are "passing through," try chatting with some of the people who live here. Commercial drive isn't about the shops. Commercial drive is about the people, and not the places. here, you'll find young people, artists trying to make it, old people who have lived here for 60 years, people of all linguistic/cultural backgrounds, hippies, computer programers, lawyers, students, bank tellers...everybody. The one thing they all have in common is a love for this neighbourhood, and the desire to live a bit more communally. So, yeah, if you just walk around, you'll think it's awful here. I was bummed out when I first moved here, and walked around. I was unimpressed when I visited. But, now, I call this place home. Any tourist who has come to stay with us on the drive for more than a few days has been enchanted by it. Come visit us. We'll like you, and we'll be happy to see you. :)

title: Arty, mellow hippy town
reviews: We visited various areas of Vancouver before settling on a place to live, but I think it's safe to say Commercial Drive stole our hearts from the get-go. I have SO much love for this place! Something we noticed travelling around was how each area of the city has a particular feel. If the bohemian hippy lifestyle resonates with you, Commercial Drive is definitely the place to be. A particularly good place to come if you want to relax, unwind, and just take time out to appreciate life (...man), and home to a fantastic range of restaurants, not to mention some beautiful parks.

title: Why bother
reviews: If I were on a tight schedule, I would have been regretful for the time I spent visiting places such as commercial drive, Gastown, Granville Island and Chinatown. I enjoy nature the best and I don't care to see small independent shops. I was tempted to visit those places as they were high rated attractions and I had enough time. I thought I might find something interesting and special about them. That didn't happen.

title: Funky central
reviews: Commercial Drive is the place to go for great food (especially italian and organic vegetarian) and for it's unique ambiance. Take an outside table at The Havana restaurant to watch the passing parade.

title: Commerical Drive No Car Day
reviews: Not worth the trip; to many store up their prices.......heard to many complaints from locals on the prices....so I left....got to sky train heard the same from many people that prices are inflated....to bad would of been nice...use to be a nice place to go but not anymore....

title: Never-ending street of joy
reviews: I absolutely LOVE the drive.  There is such a charm about this neighbour.  I love the food, little boutiques and the grocery shops.  This is the perfect venture for someone with ADD because there is just so much to check out.  The food is also amazing because there is such a great variety.  From $2 pizza joints to authenic pho to Caribbean food at the Reef.  If anything, do a little food sampling when you are at the drive.
